questions.question: Which of the following is not a downside of fully meshing BGP peers?
Without route reflectors or confederations, how do IBGP peers have to be organized in a Transit AS?

options.text: IBGP peers must use OSPF as an IGP.
IBGP peers must be peered with EBGP peers.
IBGP peers must be limited in numbers.
IBGP peers must be fully meshed with each other.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: IBGP peers must be fully meshed with each other..

questions.question: What kind of routing protocol runs within an organization's or enterprise's autonomous system?

Approximately how many routing table entries does an Internet BGP router currently hold?

options.text: BGP permits highly flexible routing policy.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: BGPadvertises any intra-AS topology changes..

questions.question: What's another name for a 'path attribute'?
With confederations, Member ASs are connected by BGP peers running which protocol?
What would a BGP peer router do if it received no Keepalive message from its peer router within the required timeframe?

options.text: Send a Notification message to ask if the peer is 'alive'.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: End the BGP peering..

questions.question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: BGP is the only routing protocol used to connect autonomous systems.
BGP is a very popular inter-AS routing protocol, but OSPF can also be used.
There are several routing protocols used to connect autonomous systems,

questions.explanation: Correct answer: BGP is the only routing protocol used to connect autonomous systems..

questions.question: Why do you need to be careful using BGP 'redistribute' statements?

options.text: Because they can create network loops.
Because they will not share private addresses/prefixes.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: Because they will share the entire set of local IGP prefixes if you don't use some form.

options.text: The state model is called a Finite State Machine.
Each state has a direct path to the 'Idle' state.
There are time duration dependencies for all state transitions.
The state machine has six states.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: There are time duration dependencies for all state transitions..

questions.question: Which two statements are used to instruct a router to share prefixes?

options.text: Todifferentiate between IBGP and EBGP-connected peers.
Toenablea BGP router to select the best path to a network prefix.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: Toenablea BGP router to select the best path to a network prefix..

options.text: Paths marked with an 'i' at the end of their AS path description.
Paths with a low number of AS hops.

questions.question: In Accumulated IGP ('AIGP'), what is being accumulated?

During the 'Internal/External tiebreaker step, which type of routes will BGP remove from consideration?

options.text: All routes with an AS Hop count of more than one.
All routes received from another BGP peer.
All routes received through an Update message.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: All routes received via iBGP.

questions.question: Which of the following does not exist in a modern network that uses switches rather than hubs.
What field in an Ethernet header comes between the Destination Address field and the Type field?

options.text: all interfaces in the same VLAN

questions.explanation: Correct answer: all interfaces connected to switches.

Bridges and switches increase the number of collision domains in a network.

options.text: (i) based on QoS, (ii) based on MAC addresses
(i) at layer two, (ii) at layer three

questions.explanation: Correct answer: (i) in hardware, (ii) in software.

questions.question: At which speed does an 10@@Base-LX1@ Ethernet connection operate?

options.text: After the Source Address field and before the Type field.
Directly after the Destination Address field.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: After the Source Address field and before the Type field..

questions.explanation: Correct answer: Access ports or Trunk ports.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: Service tag / S-tag and Customer tag / C-tag.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: There is only one active path between any two points..

questions.explanation: Correct answer: Flawless interaction with legacy bridges.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: In the Data field..

questions.explanation: Correct answer: Implement proper queuing mechanisms in the routers.

options.text: The queue depth reaches the minimum occupancy threshold.
The queue depth reaches a point where drop probability is 10@.
The queue depth reaches a point where drop probability is 1.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: The queue depth reaches a point where drop probability is 1..

same class How many QoS classes are supported by the Ethernet standard?

options.text: Nodes not in any DS domain.
Boundary nodes with the same defined PHBs and DSCP-to-PHB mappings.

options.text: A queue is infinite in length.
Queues are always emptied in a round-robin fashion, one packet from each queue at a time.
It will only work properly if the flow of traffic is bursty.
Packets arriving are put in different queues in a round-robin fashion, depending on which

questions.explanation: Correct answer: It will only work properly if the flow of traffic is bursty..

questions.question: arrive first. Why do many IP networks use a 'meshed' topology?

options.text: To provide resiliency and additional capacity.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: To provide resiliency and additional capacity..

questions.explanation: Correct answer: IP connects users to services over networks such as the Internet..

questions.question: Which is a true statement about using IPv4 and IPv6 in the same network?

options.text: It is possible only if 128-bit IPv4 addressing is used.
It is not possible - you must use one or the other, but not both.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: It is possible for both to co-exist..

questions.question: vendor. Before IP networks were established as multiservice networks ('One IP network'), how were networks built?

questions.section: Knowledge Assessment — TCP/IP Model and Transport Layer
questions.question: Why does the Border Gateway Protocol use TCP?

options.text: Because TCP is the fastest choice.
Because TCP is the more bandwidth-efficient choice.
Because TCP is well suited to 'send and hope' applications.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: Because TCP guarantees data integrity..

questions.question: Which of the following datagram types has a header and a trailer?

questions.section: Knowledge Assessment — TCP/IP Model and Transport Layer
questions.question: What are Application port numbers used for?

options.text: They are used by Applications to specify the use of TCP or UDP.
They are used by Transport protocols to direct datagrams to the correct Application.
They are interpreted by the Network layer to apply quality of service treatments.
They are used by the Network layer to determine whether to drop packets.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: They are used by Transport protocols to direct datagrams to the correct Application..

questions.section: Knowledge Assessment — TCP/IP Model and Transport Layer
questions.question: If the TCP transport protocol is used when the end-to-end network is suffering from a relatively high number of bit errors, what could you do to try to increase throughput while maintaining data integrity?

options.text: Use the BGP transport protocol instead of TCP.
Use the UDP transport protocol instead of TCP.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: Use the BGP transport protocol instead of TCP..

questions.section: Knowledge Assessment — TCP/IP Model and Transport Layer
questions.question: Which of the following are the names for the four layers in the TCP/IP model, from 'top' to 'bottom'?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: Application, Transport, Network, Link.

questions.question: Which standards body is responsible for Internet standards?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: The Internet Engineering Task Force..

questions.section: Knowledge Assessment — TCP/IP Model and Transport Layer
questions.question: Why does the Network Time Protocol use UDP?

options.text: Because UDP has unique header fields specifically for network timing purposes.
Because speed is the most important requirement.

Because data integrity is the most important requirement.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: Because speed is the most important requirement..

questions.question: Which phrase represents the UDP transport strategy?

options.text: Private IP addresses use 24-bit length addresses.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: Private IP addresses are not routable externally..

questions.explanation: Correct answer: Through route summarization between autonomous systems..

Keeps track of the topology changes within its own area

questions.explanation: Correct answers: Sends packets destined for a different area to the closest Level 1/2 IS in its own area; Keeps track of the topology changes within its own area.

So Can have neighbors in the same and different areas

questions.question: Which router will a Level 1 router choose when it needs to send a packet destined fora different area?

options.text: It chooses the closest Level 1 or Level 2 router in the area (based on path cost).

questions.explanation: Correct answer: It chooses the Level 1 router having the shortest path to the destination..

options.text: Default gateway configured for the originating IS
Networks connected to the originating IS
A List of networks existing in the given area

questions.explanation: Correct answers: Networks connected to the originating IS; A List of networks existing in the given area.

questions.question: All IS-IS routers within the same area must have the same topology database.
A Level 1 router can have adjacent neighbors in a different area.
How do IS routers learn a network topology?

options.text: By examining content of received LSPs
Through hello packets received from the neighbors
Through static configuration provisioned by a network administrator

questions.explanation: Correct answer: By examining content of received LSPs.

questions.question: IS systems are considered neighbors when:

options.text: They both received hello messages confirming neighbor status
They both received hello messages from each other
They belong to the same area

questions.explanation: Correct answer: They both received hello messages confirming neighbor status.

questions.question: Routing between different areas refers to which level of routing?
What challenge does broadcast network present from the topology perspective?

options.text: Broadcast segments are seen as a star by outside systems
Broadcast segments are seen as a full mesh by outside systems
Broadcast networks don't allow for DIS deployment
Broadcast segments generate too much control traffic

questions.explanation: Correct answer: Broadcast segments generate too much control traffic.

questions.question: Which are IS-IS router types? (Choose three)
An L1/L2 router maintains two separate IP routing tables.
An L1/L2 router maintains two separate link state databases.
What is true about a Level 1 router?

options.text: It contains both a Level 1 and a Level 2 link-state database
It can have Level 1 and Level 2 adjacent neighbors
It knows the topology only of its own area

questions.explanation: Correct answer: It knows the topology only of its own area.

questions.question: Which action or actions can a Label Edge Router (LER) perform?
Which is another common name for an MPLS header?
What do MPLS labels identify?

options.text: The best path from customer edge to customer edge
The paths with the lowest cost
The LSRs with the least downtime

questions.explanation: Correct answer: Established paths between endpoints.

questions.question: What is the purpose of Differentiated Services or DiffServ?

options.text: It can prioritize which LER or LSR that shall transmit a data packet
It enables comparisons between LSPs just like Open Shortest Path First (OSPF)
It is used for prioritization purposes
It adds MPLS labels to identify VPNs

questions.explanation: Correct answer: It is used for prioritization purposes.

questions.question: What are routers that operate at the edge of MPLS networks called?
At which layer in the OSI model is MPLS said to operate?
What kind of data can MPLS carry?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: All the above and more.

questions.question: What does the Traffic Class field in an MPLS label identify?

options.text: The class of the MPLS path

questions.question: MPLS inserts an MPLS header in packets. What is the most common mode for how this is done?
Where is the MPLS header located in a packet that contains a Layer 2 header and a payload header?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: Right of the Layer 2 header.

questions.question: What do MPLS labels identify?

options.text: The paths with the lowest cost
The best path from customer edge to customer edge
The LSRs with the least downtime

questions.explanation: Correct answer: Established paths between endpoints.

questions.question: What is one router type in an MPLS network called?
What kind of data can MPLS carry?
questions.explanation: Correct answer: All the above and more.

questions.question: Can MPLS carry data for circuit-based networks and packet-switched networks?

options.text: Yes, unless it is duplex traffic

questions.question: How many Label Switch Paths (LSPs) does duplex traffic require?
Which descriptions match (1) Convergence-based resilience and (2) Fast Reroute (FRR)?

options.text: (1) Passive handling with recalculation and (2) fast handling with recalculation
(1) Reactive handling with recalculation and (2) proactive handling with pre-calculation
(1) Proactive handling with recalculation and (2) inactive handling with pre-calculation

questions.explanation: Correct answer: (1) Reactive handling with recalculation and (2) proactive handling with pre-calculation.

questions.question: At which layer in the OSI model do LDP and RSVP-TE operate?
Which label distribution mode or modes are available for RSVP-TE?

options.text: Downstream on Demand and Unsolicited Downstream

questions.question: For RSVP-TE, where is a description of the LSP stored?

options.text: In an Explicit Route Object (ERO) in all routers along the LSP
In a Little Fast Information Base in all MPLS routers
In an Explicit Route Object (ERO) in the ingress and egress routers only
In the shim header of each packet

questions.explanation: Correct answer: In an Explicit Route Object (ERO) in all routers along the LSP.

questions.question: Which protocol selects the path to activate as an LSP?

options.text: LDP and the IGP through a negotiation

questions.question: Which is the main difference between LDP and RSVP-TE?

options.text: RSVP-TE provides greater control over LSPs
LDP provides greater control over LSPs
LDP has a higher operational overhead

questions.explanation: Correct answer: RSVP-TE provides greater control over LSPs.

questions.question: Based on what does RSVP-TE select a Label Switched Path (LSP)?

options.text: A manually defined Forwarding Equivalence Class (FEC)
The RFC with the highest number

questions.explanation: Correct answer: A manually defined Forwarding Equivalence Class (FEC).

questions.question: For every network prefix in the FIB, LDP in the Label Edge Routers (LERs) and Label Switch Routers (LSRs) binds FECs to...?
Which area plays the main role in the OSPF concept?
The routing table is required by router in order to forward traffic.
What type of protocol is OSPF?
All areas must be connected to the Backbone area.
What are the reasons to divide one large network into multiple smaller areas? (Choose 2)

options.text: It increases the number of routing recalculations in the routing database.
It reduces the number of routing recalculations in the routing database.
It increases the total number of possible connected subscribers.
It makes all changes inside any area invisible for all other areas .
It simplifies the architecture of the network.

questions.explanation: Correct answers: It reduces the number of routing recalculations in the routing database.; It makes all changes inside any area invisible for all other areas ..

questions.question: Choose the true statement.

options.text: OSPF is used to exchange routing information and calculate best paths to all sources.
OSPF is used to exchange routing information and calculate best paths to all destinations.
OSPF is used to forward data between sources and destinations.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: OSPF is used to exchange routing information and calculate best paths to all destinations..

questions.question: In the OSPF there are different roles routers can perform.
Area Border Router is the router which :

options.text: Connects one or more areas to the Backbone Area.
Represents the multi-access network and its attached routers to the rest of the OSPF area.
Whose interfaces belong to the same area.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: Connects one or more areas to the Backbone Area..

questions.question: Which area plays the main role in the OSPF concept?
In a broadcast network, OSPF routers form adjacencies with which of the following?
Choose the Link-State Advertisements from the list (Choose three).
questions.explanation: Correct answers: Router LSA; Network LSA; Summary LSA.

questions.question: BDR stands for:
Each Autonomous Boundary Router (ABR) must have at least one interface connected to the Backbone Area.
Choose the Backbone Area.
In the OSPF there are different types of routers.
OSPF uses TCP as a transport protocol.
Which is a security principle from the CIA Triad?
Working with the CIA Triad usually requires...

options.text: prioritizing the Triad principles in their order (C-I-A).
making sure to meet all Triad principles fully.
choosing one of the principles according to business objectives.

questions.explanation: Correct answer: balancing the Triad principles..

questions.question: Which is the concept of controlling what a user can do after they are allowed access to a system?
Which risk treatment involves buying insurance or outsourcing the risk to another organization?
What is a weakness that could be exploited by a threat called?
Safeguards are also known as....?
What is the concept that a user cannot deny that they performed an action on a system called?
Standards relating to the specification of the IPsec protocol are published by whom?
Which of the following are both true statements about Transport mode compared with Tunnel mode?

options.text: Transport mode produces smaller packets, Tunnel mode is more secure
Transport mode produces smaller packets, Tunnel mode is less secure
Transport mode produces larger packets, Tunnel mode is less secure
Transport mode produces larger packets, Tunnel mode is more secure

questions.explanation: Correct answer: Transport mode produces smaller packets, Tunnel mode is more secure.

questions.question: Pre-Shared Key (PSK) takes the form of ___

options.text: An electronic chip device containing a secure ID
A certificate generated by the device vendor
A pseudo-random numeric sequence generated as a software toke
A text string, entered manually by an administrator

questions.explanation: Correct answer: A text string, entered manually by an administrator.

questions.question: Which one of the following statements about Child SAs is true?

options.text: Child SAs are established before the IKE SA
Child SAs are related to one or more IKE SAs
Child SAs are renewed typically every 24 hours
Child SAs are created in unidirectional pairs

questions.explanation: Correct answer: Child SAs are created in unidirectional pairs.

questions.question: IPsec sits at which layer of the OSI stack?
Which statement is correct about an IPsec VPN?

options.text: An IPsec VPN exists between two IPsec peers
An IPsec VPN is always secured by Pre-Shared Keys
An IPsec VPN only exists when IPsec is used in transport mode
An IPsec VPN consists of one Child SA pair

questions.explanation: Correct answer: An IPsec VPN exists between two IPsec peers.

questions.question: ESP provides encryption and authentication, AH provides what?
Secure keys are used for what?

options.text: Traffic protection and outer header calculation

questions.explanation: Correct answer: Traffic protection and peer authentication.
